isis.stitle: CAB: 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 AND 8600 MODELS - INSTALL - WINDSHIELD WASHER BOTTLE with PUMP MOTOR

svcproc.title: WINDSHIELD WASHER BOTTLE with PUMP MOTOR

svcsubproc.title: Install Windshield Washer Bottle with Pump Motor on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700 and 8500 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600 and 8500 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Model
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 123 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: The washer bottle (Item 1) and pump motor (Item 2) are located under the cab door on the driver side. Use the following steps to install washer bottle and pump motor.
To install the washer bottle (Item 1) with pump motor (Item 2) as a unit, follow the procedures below.
If any one of the four speed nuts (Item 14) located on the two washer bottle mounting brackets (Item 13) are damaged, remove and replace them.

Position washer bottle (Item 1) with pump motor (Item 2) onto washer bottle brackets (Item 13). Install four hex flanged bolts (Item 12) through washer bottle, two each into each washer bottle bracket. DO NOT over tighten.

Push the remote fill hose (Item 10) over the washer bottle fill port (Item 11). Slide the hose clamp (Item 9) up to the washer bottle fill port. Squeeze together the tabs on the hose clamp and slide it over the remote fill hose coming from the remote fill cap.
Install windshield washer hose (Item 7) over pump motor outlet port (Item 8).
Connect wiring harness connector (Item 4) to the pig tail connector (Item 5) of the low fluid sensor (Item 6).
Connect wiring harness connector (Item 3) to pump motor (Item 2).
Fill washer bottle (Item 1) with windshield washer solvent and check for leaks and washer operation.
Tilt hood to fully closed position and latch hood on both sides.
